Today’s IDK who needs to hear this: COVID isn’t going away-  there will continue to be new variants! 

To move forward we need to promote three doses and then move to an annual fall update. 

Scientists are monitoring a new omicron subvariant called BA.2 https://t.co/JBCoxkgNWJ

“Conventional wisdom held that distrust of health systems & misinformation kept Covid vaccines from going into arms in Black communities. But new evidence shows that hesitancy there waned faster than in white communities -
which could inform future appeals about new treatments.” https://t.co/Bj9V2suokW

@nick13129361 @DevWallace1 The rules definitely are both confusing and haven’t caught up with the science. But they said, the bigger problem in Indiana schools is even if your kid is there, there’s a good chance their teacher is out with covid.  Over 100 teachers out one day last week in HSE.

@DevWallace1 Restating this- Where are kids actually being forced  to get vaccinated against covid to attend class in public schools? I’ve always said we shouldn’t mandate vaccines in kids while under EUA.

Covid treatments are a great airbag- only helpful after you’ve already crashed- may help, but may not. 

But vaccines are like the collision avoidance systems in your car- they prevent you from getting in an accident in the first place.

RT @JeromeAdamsMD: Todays “ I don’t know who needs to hear this:”

A kid w/ appendicitis who tests positive before surgery is “with” covid.…
